text: [Music]
I think basically that's what it
requires and it requires I think you
have to be able to sit in sit in
restaurants for a long time but you have
to be able to you have to enjoy it first
of all you have to enjoy at least eating
uh and eating all sorts of strange foods
because if you don't you won't
communicate any of that in in your
writing and what you're doing when
you're critic you're judging these these
restaurants ostensibly but you're really
communicating the experience and um
whether good or bad and so if if you're
bored all the time
or feeling dyspeptic all the time or
just if you don't like food you're not
going to last very long and and you're
probably not going to be that fun to
read
either I think I think Frank brudy is a
great
and I don't I think um we're writers
first of all and like I said our job is
to communicate sort of what's happening
because most of the people who read our
reviews don't go to these
restaurants U they sort of get a
vicarious uh pleasure from reading them
so I think first of all you have to be
able to write I think it's it's it's a
great uh it helps a lot to know a lot
about food but when you're when you when
you're when you're writing about
restaurants uh what I try to do is I try
to write from the perspective of uh the
diner and I've eaten in a lot of
restaurants so I know what it's like I I
I can get a fairly good idea as to you
know what's good what's bad and that
that you know that comes with experience
eating in restaurants it doesn't
necessarily come um uh from knowing how
to cook a you know a milu or some some
say in French pastry but I I'll say that
you know when you look at the land
landscape of food writers they're really
sort of two kinds of writers they are
the more food oriented more
incremental uh writers who who
who you know look at what's on the plate
and explain to you the recipes and
analyze things very minutely and then
there are the more eclectic experiential
writers
uh RW Apple was a classic example of
that at the Times who who like I said
communicate the experience and wander
around with their expanding bellies and
generally um have a good time and that's
sort of what I try to
do
